definition: the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose

sentences.english: Being gable to speak English is a top priority.
sentences.chinese: 学会说英语是事不宜迟。

sentences.english: Speed is desirable, must hurry to action.
sentences.chinese: 事不宜迟，必须赶紧行动。

sentences.english: Health care reform must happen this year.
sentences.chinese: 无须赘言，事不宜迟，这项改革年内一定会展开。

sentences.english: The sooner, the better. All decisions should be transparent.
sentences.chinese: 事不宜迟，且所有的决策均应公开透明。

sentences.english: We could not afford any delay and went to the big hospital immediately.
sentences.chinese: 事不宜迟，我们立刻到社区的大医院去。

definition: to go on a journey/to leave
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to make a long story short (idiom)
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
to set off/to take to the road
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
erhua variant of 等一會|等一会[deng3 yi1 hui4]
